forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain before 5am. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 52. Southwest wind 7 to 10 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 57 in the afternoon. West wind 7 to 13 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph.

weather_report:
As twilight settles over Downtown San Francisco, the city breathes a collective sigh amid the promise of rain whispering on the horizon. The air, tinged with the coolness typical of spring nights, drapes itself around you like a soft, familiar shawl, with a gentle breeze stirring from the southwest. The cozy enveloping clouds hint at a possibility of light rain before dawn, a 40% chance that feels quite likely, given the soft murmur of the wind. A temperature hovering around 52 invites you to indulge in layers, perhaps a light sweater beneath a waterproof jacket, just in case nature's whimsy unfurls.

As Friday dawns, the sun is expected to break through the clouds, unveiling a mostly sunny day, yet reminding us of the ever-present coolness that defines this coastal town. While the high nudges toward 59, it will gradually retreat into the mid-50s by afternoon, suggesting a persistent freshness that makes the outdoors inviting yet brisk. On a day like this, take a stroll through the quieter streets of the Mission, enjoy a warm cup of coffee at a local café while the morning light filters through the mingling clouds, or perhaps meander towards the Golden Gate Park, indulging in a few moments of solitude as the world awakens around you. Embrace the pleasant simplicity of an urban spring day, as San Francisco gently pulses with life beneath a comfortably unpredictable sky.
